definition: to take up a post/to start in a new job

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: He is currently a deputy general manager of BNS Group Company.
sentences.chinese: 出任北辰集團公司副總經理。

sentences.english: Confirming reports over the past few days, Juventus have officially appointed Ciro Ferrara as their coach for next season.
sentences.chinese: 尤文官方宣佈費拉拉出任下賽季球隊主教練。

sentences.english: 1988 went out with a new President taking office in the United Sates.
sentences.chinese: 1988年隨着美國新總統的出任而結束。

sentences.english: In the meantime she takes up other social positions like the vice president of Liaoning Overseas Friends Sodality .
sentences.chinese: 同時出任遼寧省海外聯誼會副會長等多項社會職務。

sentences.english: There is a rumor going the rounds that Mr Wonton will be the new superintendent.
sentences.chinese: 到處都傳說諾頓先生將出任新督監。

sentences.english: He is offered a directorship with Smith Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 有限公司請他出任董事。

sentences.english: Both sides also discussed taking the post of propagandizes ambassador the incident.
sentences.chinese: 雙方還商討了出任宣傳大使一事。

sentences.english: And he has hinted that he could return to the presidency in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示他將於2012年再次出任俄羅斯總統的職位。

sentences.english: For one thing, he took command of a ragged army of revolutionaries.
sentences.chinese: 首先，他勇敢地出任一支破破爛爛的革命軍的司令。

sentences.english: After that, he became the Chief Designer of department store Lane Crawford.
sentences.chinese: 之後，任氏出任連卡佛百貨公司之首席設計師。

sentences.english: In 1844 Calhoun became Secretary of State.
Liu Bai first stand up and say to left cold chan as owners.
sentences.chinese: 陸柏第一個站出來說要左冷禪出任掌門。

sentences.english: Wenger's first move into management came a year later when he accepted a post with Nancy Lorraine.
sentences.chinese: 一年後他接受南錫俱樂部的邀請，第一次出任主教練。

sentences.english: He will chair the all-party group meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他將出任那個各黨議員小組會議的主席。

sentences.english: 54-year-old Zhou took Yongzhi Wang's place as chief designer 5 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 5年前接替王永志出任總設計師的周建平娓娓道來。

sentences.english: She served as high school is the famous universities charge wenwu double royal hall college.
sentences.chinese: 她出任的高中是文武雙收的有名高校御堂學院。

to be promoted to

to hold an office or post

post/position/job/duties
